samples.context: Several diseases, including cholera, tuberculosis, smallpox, and hepatitis can be prevented by vaccination. A worldwide campaign against smallpox has finally led to its eradication from most parts of the world. These days vaccines are made on a large scale from microorganisms to protect humans and other animals from several diseases.
samples.question: Which disease has been eradicated globally?

samples.context: Some bacteria are able to fix nitrogen from the atmosphere to enrich soil with nitrogen and increase its fertility. These microbes are commonly called biological nitrogen fixers. The plant waste has been converted into manure by the action of microbes. The nutrients released in the process can be used by the plants again.
samples.question: What role do biological nitrogen fixers play?
